BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Governor and the State Legislature to place a moratorium on all executions in New York until the application of capital punishment in New York is investigated and issues of fairness, justice, equality, due process and cost are addressed; and calling upon the United States Congress to pass S.233/H.R.1038, the "National Death Penalty Moratorium Act of 2001," and H.R. 321, the "Accuracy in Judicial Administration Act of 2001."

Resolution urging the Governor and the State Legislature to place a moratorium on all executions in New York until the application of capital punishment in New York is investigated and issues of fairness, justice, equality, due process and cost are addressed; and calling upon the United States Congress to pass S.233/H.R.1038, the "National Death Penalty Moratorium Act of 2001," and H.R. 321, the "Accuracy in Judicial Administration Act of 2001."

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Perkins, Barron, Gallagher, Davis, Jackson and Brewer.
